intro: Pavetta jambosifolia, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal by wind or water.
